pr_title: Pod terminated without a container is not processed by TitusMaster

timeline.message:
Pod terminated without a container is not processed by TitusMaster

Instead, TitusMaster waits indefinitely for it to complete. Such pods
are not GCed, as they stay in the Accepted state in TitusMaster.

timeline.bodyText: minor: thoughs on centralizing this logic into PodWrapper? e.g.: something like PodWrapper#isTerminated()
timeline.author: fabiokung

timeline.bodyText: same here, maybe move some of this logic into the PodWrapper and reuse below on line 268, e.g.: PodWrapper#getReasonCode()
timeline.author: fabiokung

replies.bodyText: It is good idea, and we should better centralize pod -> task state mapping. I will postpone this to another PR, as it is much more work, and would touch other classes.
replies.author: tbak

timeline.bodyText: Nice, I really like centralizing stuff in here
